description: boom
A fridge for keeping food cool.  Provides some insulation from outside weather.
A large metal tank for holding liquids.  Useful for crafting.

name: TEST rock
description: A rock the size of a baseball.  Makes a decent melee weapon, and is also good for throwing at enemies.
A copper ring that makes you a little stronger when you wear it.
An old-fashioned pair of leather rollerskates with steel frames.  While quite fast on flat floors, they make it difficult to take hits or to move on rough terrain.
A pair of inline skates.  Very fast on flat floors, but they make it hard to move on rough terrain, take hits, or dodge effectively.

name: TEST cotton patchwork
description: This is a largish piece of cloth, useful in crafting and possibly for staunching bleeding.

name: TEST rag bundle
description: This is a bundle of 100 cotton patchwork pieces tied together with a piece of string.

name: TEST knotted ball of string
description: This is a ball of 100 short pieces of string, all tangled and knotted together.

name: TEST plank
description: A narrow, thick plank of wood, like a 2 by 4 or similar piece of dimensional lumber.  Makes a decent melee weapon, and can be used for all kinds of construction.

name: TEST pipe
description: A steel pipe, makes a good melee weapon.  Useful in a few crafting recipes.

name: TEST pipe
description: A steel pipe, makes a good melee weapon.  Useful in a few crafting recipes.

name: TEST pipe
description: A steel pipe, makes a good melee weapon.  Useful in a few crafting recipes.
This is a set of shears designed to obtain wool from sheep.
This is a set of shears designed to obtain wool from sheep.
This is a set of shears designed to obtain wool from sheep.
This is a set of electric shears designed to obtain wool from sheep.
This is a set of electric shears designed to obtain wool from sheep.  These shears have been turned on.
This is a cordless battery-powered drill with a selection of drill bits.
A common belt with pockets, loops and sheaths to store up to six tools or blades.  Widely used by handymen and electricians.
A common belt with pockets, loops and sheaths to store up to six tools or blades.  Widely used by handymen and electricians.
This is a test crowbar from early pocket implementation tests.  Some or all of these values will possibly not match the current in-game stats, so beware.
This is a test hammer from early pocket implementation tests.  Some or all of these values will possibly not match the current in-game stats, so beware.
This is a test wrench from early pocket implementation tests.  Some or all of these values will possibly not match the current in-game stats, so beware.
This is a test tongs from early pocket implementation tests.  Some or all of these values will possibly not match the current in-game stats, so beware.
Holy pockets, Batman!  This belt has all kinds of pockets for testing.

pocket_data.//: Small pouch for a pocket knife, screwdriver, or multi-tool.  Just long enough for a test screwdriver, but not long enough for a sonic screwdriver.
Large holster for an axe or Halligan bar
Flexible water pouch for drinks or other liquid.  Integrated straw for fast access.
Pressure-tight canister for emergency oxygen supply or other gas.
Fire-proof pouch for thermite or other combustible materials.
Micro cooler to preserve snacks for long stakeouts.
Cryo-chamber to deep-freeze organic samples.  Small, but prevents spoiling indefinitely.

description: This is a typical household flashlight with a plastic handle.  Using this flashlight will turn it on and provide light, assuming it is charged with batteries.

name: TEST sheet metal
description: A thin sheet of metal.
//: Roughly in the 70cm×70cm×1.5mm to 1m×1m×0.75mm range. Has to be folded / rolled up when in inventory, so 75% density compared to solid block.

name: TEST small metal sheet
description: A small sheet of metal.
//: Roughly in the 15cm×15cm to 20cm×20cm range. Compact and stacks well, so equally dense as a solid block.

name: TEST Halligan bar
description: This is a heavy multiple-use tool commonly carried by firefighters, law enforcement, and military rescue units.  Use it to open locked doors without destroying them or to lift manhole covers.  You could also wield it to bash some heads in.

name: TEST Halligan bar no nail prying
TEST fire axe
description: This is a large, two-handed pickhead axe normally used by firefighters.  It makes a powerful melee weapon, but is a bit slow to recover between swings.

name: TEST fire axe
description: This is a large, two-handed pickhead axe normally used by firefighters.  It makes a powerful melee weapon, but is a bit slow to recover between swings.

name: TEST fire axe
description: This is a large, two-handed pickhead axe normally used by firefighters.  It makes a powerful melee weapon, but is a bit slow to recover between swings.

name: TEST screwdriver
description: This is a Philips-head screwdriver.  It is important for almost all electronics crafting, most mechanics crafting, and has many more uses.

name: TEST sonic screwdriver
description: This is a sonic screwdriver.  Like a normal screwdriver, but sonic.
Some kind of super-multi-tool, like a swiss army knife with a pocket dimension.

name: TEST soldering iron
description: This is a device with a metal tip that can get very hot.  It is necessary for advanced electronics crafting.
Test book reader.
This is a test disposable battery.
This is a test battery that may be recharged.

name: TEST scissor jack
description: A compact scissor jack used for lifting vehicles.

A popular, fancy smartphone.  Capable of making photos due to integrated camera and illuminating an area as per flashlight app, assuming it has enough charge.  The smartphone also has a clock app that includes an alarm.  Runs on a small, rechargeable power cell compatible with Unified Power Supply.

use_action.need_charges_msg: The smartphone's charge is too low.

description: Test mp3 player
Socks.  Put 'em on your feet.
Goofy-looking socks with zero ankle coverage and lots of holes on top.  For testing only, nobody would actually wear these, right?
Industrial grade ear plugs.  They fit inside the ear.

name: TEST tail encumbrance
description: Tests the effects of encumbrance on the test body part.

name: TEST hazmat suit
description: An impermeable whole-body garment worn as protection against hazardous materials.  Though very restrictive and fragile, wearing it will provide complete protection against ambient radiation.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.

name: TEST hazmat suit
description: An impermeable whole-body garment worn as protection against hazardous materials.  Though very restrictive and fragile, wearing it will provide complete protection against ambient radiation.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.

name: TEST hazmat suit
description: An impermeable whole-body garment worn as protection against hazardous materials.  Though very restrictive and fragile, wearing it will provide complete protection against ambient radiation.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.
Full-body suit completely covering all body parts, including the head, mouth, and eyes.
Full-body suit completely covering all body parts, including the head, mouth, and eyes.
Full-body suit completely covering all body parts, including the head, mouth, and eyes.
When your tests are so bright, you have to wear shades.
The tanktop of the future.  Super armor with almost infinite defensive power.
A portable plastic dome to keep the rain and sun off.

name: TEST compound bow
description: A high-power bow with shaped cams and extra cables for high velocity shots that can be used effectively by fairly strong archers.  Currently set to a medium weight.

use_action.msg: You tighten the limbs, increasing the strength of the bow.

description: A handful of tasty crunchy nuts from a pinecone.
A variety of almonds with traces of hydrocyanic acid, potentially toxic when eaten raw.
With high levels of the psychoactive myristicin, high doses of nutmeg can cause hallucinations and euphoria, along with a lot of nasty side effects.
Test apple.  May contain worms, but tastes delicious!
Test egg, very much like a bird egg, but a little too perfect.  Does not need to be cooked.
//: Omitting the RAW flag so calories will be taken at face value.

name: TEST gallon jug
description: A standard plastic jug used for milk and household cleaning chemicals.

name: TEST gallon jug with large opening
TEST small waterskin
description: A small watertight leather bag with a carrying strap, can hold 1.5 liters of water.
Stretchy, watertight, and airtight - the perfect trial balloon.
This condom is only for testing, and should not be used as a birth control device.
A factory-sealed aluminum can for testing.
A steel can that thinks its made of tin, maybe useful for testing, but you wouldn't want to eat out of it.
A large, human size, rectangular bag made of strong plastic, with a zipper in the middle.  Used to hold a dead body.
A huge test duffel bag.  Provides plenty of storage, but is severely encumbering.

name: TEST backpack
description: A small backpack.  Good storage for a little encumbrance.

name: TEST backpack
description: A small backpack designed for testing nesting issues.  Good storage for a little encumbrance.

name: TEST briefcase
description: Useful for carrying money, documents, or smuggled goods.
Quiver of Testing, with room for 20 arrows or bolts.
Test arrow
A simple wood pole with one end sharpened.

name: TEST clumsy sword
description: A poorly balanced sword for test purposes

name: TEST normal sword
description: A sword for test purposes

name: TEST balanced sword
description: A well-balanced sword for test purposes

A long strip of braided leather with a handle on one end.  Originally developed to settle disagreements with cattle, it's better used now for flaying the rotten flesh off of walking corpses.  Great for when a problem comes along.
A sturdy polearm with a sizable, single-edged blade on the end.
A handgun for testing, based on the Glock 9mm.
A handgun for testing barrel lengths, based on nothing.
A shortened barrel results in markedly reduced accuracy and a minor increase in noise, but also greatly improves the ease with which the weapon can be carried and wielded.
Magazine exclusively designed for Test Glocks.
30-round magazine exclusively for use with the Test Glock.
Generic 9mm ammo based on JHP.
Generic 100mm ammo.
Test ammo based on the .45 JHP.
No clue what it's made of, but it's definitely liquid.  Only for testing, do not drink!
Some mysterious substance in the form of a gas.  Only for testing, do not inhale!
A simple 1-liter cardboard box of deliberately undefined proportions.

pocket_data.//: max_item_length is left undefined on purpose, to test default length from volume

description: A test welding tank full of oxyacetylene.
An acetylene torch.

name: test 14 cm rod
description: A thin rod exactly 14 cm in length

name: test 15 cm rod
description: A thin rod exactly 15 cm in length
Test bolt cutters.

name.str: test electric pair of bolt cutters

description: Test bolt cutters which uses batteries.
Gun suppressor mod for testing.
Test hacksaw.
Test hacksaw which uses batteries.
You can only push a drink so far before it spoils.

name: tennis ball wine must
description: Unfermented tennis ball wine.  A rubbery, boiled juice made from mashed tennis balls.
Cheap booze made from fermented tennis ball juice.  Tastes just like it sounds.
This is a test coffee carafe designed to keep atomic beverages extra radioactive.  It leaks radiation all the time.
Curiously stimulating and thirst-quenching blueberry-flavored chewing gum.
A smooth white block of cleaned and rendered animal fat.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
A smooth white block of cleaned and rendered animal fat.  It will remain edible for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many foods and projects.
Also known as pork rinds or chicharrones, these are bits of edible fat and skin that have been fried until they are crispy and delicious.

name.str: In the Beginning… Was the Command Line
name.str_pl: copies of In the Beginning… Was the Command Line

description: Humorous 1999 essay by Neal Stephenson comparing computer operating system vendors to car dealerships.

name.str_pl: copies of Principles of Compiler Design

description: Alfred Aho and Jeffrey Ullman's classic 1977 computer science textbook.  Features a cover drawing of a knight wielding an LALR parser generation and syntax directed translation against the metaphorical green dragon, The Complexity of Compiler Design.
This is a prototype power armor just for testing.
This is a prototype power armor just for testing.
Sleek and lightweight Kevlar cat harness with a protective hood and chestplate.  Includes a very small, inconvenient velcro pocket on the back.

pocket_data.//: It takes you an extremely long time to make your cat hold still.

description: Test matches - when you must burn things, for science!
A misshapen human thumb.  Eating this would be incredibly disgusting and probably cause you to mutate.

//: This is well within the pricing structure I found for ballistic vest, shins, and LBE.  LEO gear ain't cheap.
description: A suit of black bulletproof armor with lots of pockets.  The word SWAT is emblazoned across the back.
A hefty pair of fur-lined pants.
A pair of long cotton pants lined with warm imitation fur.

name.str_sp: faux fur pants suit test thing

description: A TEST OBJECT SHOULD NOT BE IN GAME
One milliliter liquid.
One milliliter solid.
Some strange can from another dimension.  It can be worn on the waist.
Sweet citrus fruit.  Also comes in juice form.
Essential dietary nutrients conveniently packaged in pill form.  An option of last resort when a balanced diet is not possible.  Excess use can cause hypervitaminosis.
Some strange can from another dimension.
Some strange jug from another dimension.
Some strange jug from another dimension.  It can be worn on the waist.
A backpack that somehow only holds specific containers.
Delicious vitamin food.
A baseball, good for throwing at enemies.  Getting hit with one of these hurts a lot more than you might think.

A handgun for testing, based on the Glock 9mm.

A series of strangely shaped hexagonal lenses that flutter about inside your helmet.  As the lenses shift things around you stay perfectly in focus no matter your eyesight or distance.  It can be mounted to an exosuit helmet.

This is a standard exosuit frame.  Designed to be modular, it can accept a variety of power supplies, defensive and offensive systems, and utility tools.  Slots exist for the torso, back, arms, and legs.

pocket_data.description: A series of connections for an underlayer.

description: Leg and body armor made from the exoskeletons of insects.
A dark pair of goggles.  They make seeing very difficult, but protect you from bright flashes.
A long-sleeved cotton shirt.
A jacket made from denim.
A light blue button down shirt with a couple of pockets in front and the US postal service logo embroidered on it.
A pair of big, red, 8 oz. boxing gloves.  These are made from thick leather.
Lycra test jumpsuit
Fur test jumpsuit
Cotton test jumpsuit

//: Only for the test wing body parts
description: A pair of big, red, 8 oz. gauntlets.  These are made from thick leather.

A custom-designed extremely thick ripstop and aramid poncho for the true frontier explorer.  Striped in brown and blue, the white seal of Hub 01 is emblazoned proudly on the front.  Integrating quick access pouches attached to a waist drawstring and two waterproof internal dry bags it touts plenty of storage.  This poncho also has notable clips and velcro just below the waist and around the shoulders, perhaps something attaches there.
//: at least 3x thicker than a normal poncho

description: This vest covered in MOLLE webbing is designed to attach pouches, holsters and other PALS compatible accessories.  Preferred by some soldiers over directly attaching accessories to a ballistic vest as they can then be easily separated.
Ballistic armor with specialized pockets on the front, back and sides for armored plates.  The soft armor plate carrier is still protective but it won't stop high energy projectiles.

//: Vest with no coverage to test if it still protects
description: Ballistic armor with specialized pockets on the front, back and sides for armored plates.  The soft armor plate carrier is still protective but it won't stop high energy projectiles.

A polygonal ceramic ballistic plate with a slightly concave profile.  Its inner surface is coated with Ultra High Molecular Weight Polyethylene, and is labeled "TOP", while its outer surface is labeled "STRIKE FACE".  This is intended to be worn in a ballistic vest and can withstand several high energy rifle rounds before breaking.
An armguard, 1.75mm at the thickest.  This one has been made with mild steel.
This item should have only 1 armor entry in game since these three are identical.
